definition: many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
to take charge of/to manage/department (under a ministry)

sentences.english: Globalization also means the development of multinational corporations and transnational corporations.
sentences.chinese: 全球化包括多国公司和跨国公司的成长。

sentences.english: I have long been dreaming of becoming a CEO of a multinational company.
sentences.chinese: 我没有竭胡念成为一个多国公司的CEO。

sentences.english: A huge multi-national swallowed up the business.
sentences.chinese: 一家大型的多国公司吞并了这家企业。

sentences.english: Most of this illicit trade is carried on with all the efficiency of any multinational company.
sentences.chinese: 很多的走私贸易通过多国公司的作用发生的。

pinyin: qi3 ye4 lian2 he2 zu3 zhi1
